text:
Glass, brick and brownstone front
209 - 211 East 48th Street, Manhattan
Federal Art Project
"Changing New York"
Berenice Abbott, photographer
Neg. No. 280
[Note: negative atMuseum of the City ofNew York]
Code IA-3
Feb. 1, 1938

[handwritten:]
p. 144, Changing New York
209 and 211 East 48th St., n[orth].s[ide]. e[ast] of Third Ave., showing two buildings forming a contrasting arrangement to indicate the modern trend. No. 211 was erected in 1860 by Charles Cheeseborough. W[illia]m Lescaze, architect, remodelled same in 1934, thereby producing New York's first glass brick residence.

211 East 48th Street, north side, east of Third Avenue, showing the first glass brick building. [designed by William Lescaze]

April 26, 1940

George D. Chinn
NO REPRODUCTIONS

[handwritten note, with line to "first" in caption]:
but O'God not the last! 1966
